identificationModule.briefTitle: Group Preconception Care for Fertility Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Group Preconception Care for Fertility Patients

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Director of the Penn PCOS Center

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Group Preconception Care for Fertility Patients aims to translate the well-established group prenatal care model to preconception care to improve pregnancy and neonatal outcomes. In partnership with Pomelo Care (a virtual maternity care program), the investigators are conducting this study using couples at Penn Fertility Care.

interventions.name: Group Preconception Care
interventions.description: Groups of 6-10 patients to initiate biweekly virtual group care sessions on a rolling basis, with completion of enrollment and the virtual curriculum within a year.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Blood pressure measurement recorded by clinician in Penn EMR
primaryOutcomes.description: Was a blood pressure measurement recorded by a clinician in Penn EMR, yes/no

primaryOutcomes.measure: Weight measurement recorded by clinician in Penn EMR
primaryOutcomes.description: Was a weight measurement recorded by a clinician in Penn EMR, yes/no

primaryOutcomes.measure: Hemoglobin A1c testing results recorded in Penn EMR
primaryOutcomes.description: Was a hemoglobin A1c test performed if medically indicated (history of diabetes, BMI\>30) or felt necessary by health care provider, yes/no

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Anxiety screening score
primaryOutcomes.description: Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7 (GAD-7) Questionnaire will be administered to both groups at enrollment, 4 months, and 12 months. The total score for the seven items ranges from 0 to 21, with 21 indicating a worse outcome

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Depression screening score
primaryOutcomes.description: Patient Health Questionnaire 9 (PHQ-9) will be administered to both groups at enrollment, 4 months, and 12 months. The total score for the nine items ranges from 0 to 27 where a high score indicates a worse outcome

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Fertility-related quality of life questionnaire score
primaryOutcomes.description: Fertility Related Quality of Life (FertiQOL) Questionnaire will be administered to both groups at enrollment, 4 months, and 12 months. The 36 FertiQoL items are rated according to 5 types of response scales. The total score is 100, with higher scores indicating worse fertility-related quality of life.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of ovulation stimulations
primaryOutcomes.description: Count of ovarian stimulation treatments

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of intrauterine inseminations
primaryOutcomes.description: Count of intrauterine insemination treatments

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of in vitro fertilizations
primaryOutcomes.description: Count of in vitro fertilization treatments

primaryOutcomes.measure: Pregnancy rate
primaryOutcomes.description: This includes the number of patients who become pregnant during the study period in both groups.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Time to pregnancy in days
primaryOutcomes.description: This includes the time until patients become pregnant during the study period in both groups.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Patient experience
primaryOutcomes.description: In the intervention arm only, brief questionnaires will be distributed after each virtual session to ask participants to rate their satisfaction with the session. Patients will also complete a cumulative evaluation at the conclusion of the sessions. These surveys will use a Likert scale with a higher score indicating a better experience.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Miscarriage rate
primaryOutcomes.description: Total number of miscarriages per participants who become pregnant in either group

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of pregnant participants with occurrence of a hypertensive disorder of pregnancy
primaryOutcomes.description: This will be scored yes if any of the following are noted in the medical record: gestational hypertension (blood pressure \>140/90 on 2 or more occasions at least 4 hours apart), severe preeclampsia (blood pressure \>160/110 on 2 or more occasions at least 4 hours apart, or mildly elevated blood pressures with persistent headache, scotomata, platelet count \<100,000/uL, liver function tests twice the upper limit of normal, or creatinine \>1.1 mg/dL), HELLP syndrome (hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, and low platelet count), or eclampsia (elevated blood pressure with seizures).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of pregnant participants with a diagnosis of gestational diabetes
primaryOutcomes.description: This will be scored yes if gestational diabletes is diagnosed. Gestational diabetes is diagnosed based on an abnormal 3-hour glucose tolerance test (1-hour test blood glucose \>135mg/dL will be followed by a 3-hour test). Two or more abnormal values on the 3-hour test is diagnostic of gestational diabetes. Cutoffs are 95 fasting, 180 at 1 hour, 155 at 2 hours, and 140 at 3 hours.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of pregnant participants with occurrences with an antepartum hospitalizations
primaryOutcomes.description: This includes hospital admissions during the pregnancy for any pregnancy or non-pregnancy related complications.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of pregnant participants with preterm birth
primaryOutcomes.description: Preterm delivery is defined as delivery at less than 37 weeks gestational age.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of pregnant participants with a cesarean delivery
primaryOutcomes.description: In participants who become pregnant, the incidence of cesarean delivery

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of pregnant participants with a NICU admission
primaryOutcomes.description: Infant admission to neonatal intensive care unit.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of delivery to date of discharge from hospital postpartum, up to 6 weeks from delivery

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of PEC (Perinatal Evaluation Center)/emergency room visits in pregnant participants
primaryOutcomes.description: Total number of any presentation to the Perinatal Evaluation Center or emergency room during pregnancy
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of conception to delivery date, approximately 9 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Among those patients that become pregnant, delivery length of stay
primaryOutcomes.description: Length of stay from birth to discharge, measured in hours
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of delivery to date of discharge from hospital postpartum, up to six weeks from delivery

primaryOutcomes.measure: Among those patients that become pregnant, score on the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale
primaryOutcomes.description: Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale will either be abstracted from the medical record, or if not administered clinically, will be administered by the study team. The total score for the ten items ranges from 0 to 30 with a higher score indicating a worse outcome.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Female new patient seen at Penn Fertility Care for infertility or procreative management
2. Currently planning to conceive
3. Intending to carry pregnancy (i.e. will not need a gestational carrier), since our project aims to implement lifestyle changes prior to conception
4. Willing to be randomized to group preconception care versus usual care

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Prior infertility treatment at other practice in this initial project, we aim to focus on patients with a new diagnosis of infertility to allow time for completion of the virtual program during the diagnostic phase and early treatment phase
2. Known need for gestational carrier, as above
3. Planning preimplantation genetic testing for monogenic disorders or egg/embryo banking
4. Non-English speaking
5. Unable to complete electronic questionnaires due to lack of access to technology

locations.facility: Penn Reproductive Research Unit, 3701 Market Street, Suite 810

browseBranches.name: Urinary Tract, Sexual Organs, and Pregnancy Conditions
